intro: Rhynchospora oligantha var. breviseta, commonly known as the short-hair sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with inconspicuous flowers, typical of many sedge species. It thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in coastal and inland marshes. Rhynchospora oligantha var. breviseta plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
